title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: ohvbd package allows retrieve data many different databases directly. Currently databases include VecTraits VecDyn projects VectorByte. Let’s imagine wanted figure particular vector species - Aedes aegypti, example - found. ’s ’d use ohvbd : Great, lovely. now… mean? can build data request? Read find …
code: df <- search_vt("Aedes aegypti") %>%   fetch_vt() %>%   extract_vt(     cols = c("Interactor1Genus", "Interactor1Species", "Latitude", "Longitude"),     returnunique = TRUE   ) df

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: using Linux, sometimes httr2 fails communicate VectorByte servers. systems best set ohvbd use slightly less stringent identity checks calls server. using command set_ohvbd_compat() however required per R session/script. users familiar tidyverse pipes (%>%), approach generally usable ohvbd well. users familiar, pipes take output one command feed forward next command first argument: rest vignette using piped-style approach. Another note begin: functions used interface VecTraits VecDyn basically , except vt vd function name. search_vt() VecTraits equivalent search_vd(). use VecTraits functions vignette, process VecDyn. also generic versions fetch_x() extract_x() functions (called fetch() extract()), can used place db-specific functions.
code: # Find mean of a vector normally x <- c(1, 2, 3) mean(x) ## [1] 2 # Find mean of a vector using pipes c(1, 2, 3) %>% mean() ## [1] 2

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: Datasets VecTraits VecDyn organised id. often good able see IDs currently available. can using find_x_ids() family functions. return vector valid IDs given database: functions search_x() search_x_smart() also return list IDs match query provided arguments. case let’s search VecTraits Aedes aegypti, “Yellow Fever mosquito”: returns vector IDs, time corresponding dataset Aedes aegypti one searchable columns. can also find IDs interactively online using VecTraits Explorer choose.

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: Now vector datasets, need actually retrieve data datasets API. can use fetch_x() functions. case let’s get first 5 Aedes aegypti datasets: fetch_vt() function returns list data form original httr2 responses. useful want know specifics server sent data back, usecases useful extract data dataframe.
code: aedes_responses <- fetch_vt(aedes_ids[1:5]) aedes_responses[[1]] ## <httr2_response> ## GET https://vectorbyte.crc.nd.edu/portal/api/vectraits-dataset/97/?format=json ## Status: 200 OK ## Content-Type: application/json ## Body: In memory (26362 bytes)

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: Now list responses, can extract relevant data using extract_x() functions. dataset bit large print , often may want columns data rather whole dataset. Fortunately cols argument allows us filter data easily. can also use argument returnunique instruct ohvbd return unique rows. let’s get just unique locations trait name combinations data using command :
code: aedes_data <- aedes_responses %>% extract_vt() cat("Data dimensions: ", ncol(aedes_data), " cols x ", nrow(aedes_data), " rows") ## Data dimensions:  157  cols x  21  rows aedes_data_filtered <- aedes_responses %>%   extract_vt(     cols = c("Location", "OriginalTraitName"),     returnunique = TRUE   ) aedes_data_filtered ## Database: vt ##                        Location      OriginalTraitName ## 1          University of Malaya              body size ## 2          University of Malaya        blood meal size ## 3 Guadeloupe French West Indies              longevity ## 4 Guadeloupe French West Indies          blood feeding ## 5 Guadeloupe French West Indies transmission potential

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: cases may end downloading lot data. can cause problems enough memory computer store data memory , even just want one two columns, like , One potential method mitigating use fetch_extract_x_chunked() functions. download records time extract moving next chunk ids. can perform filtered extraction like :
code: fetch_extract_vt_chunked(   aedes_ids[1:5],   chunksize = 2,   cols = c("Location", "OriginalTraitName"),   returnunique = TRUE ) ## Database: vt ##                        Location      OriginalTraitName ## 1          University of Malaya              body size ## 2          University of Malaya        blood meal size ## 3 Guadeloupe French West Indies              longevity ## 4 Guadeloupe French West Indies          blood feeding ## 5 Guadeloupe French West Indies transmission potential

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: day--day use, mostly find using functions together create small pipelines. typical pipeline likely contain lines code:
code: df <- search_vt("Aedes aegypti") %>%   fetch_vt() %>%   extract_vt(     cols = c("Interactor1Genus", "Interactor1Species", "Latitude", "Longitude"),     returnunique = TRUE   ) head(df)

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: One subtlety VectorByte search interfaces name collisions. Let’s imagine looking traits whitefly species (Bemisia). can just construct query investigate follows: Now expect traits Bemisia spp, however look Interactor1Genus column see something touch odd: Axinoscymnus ladybird, appearing? Let’s look rows containing Axinoscymnus: scenario, Bemisia present dataset, “target” rather animal trait referring . might want specific precisely data retrieve. Enter search_x_smart() family functions. allow construct specific search. let’s construct search wanting , smart search. made sure search Interactor1Genus column. gotten back Bemisia traits! sort collision particularly common “Citation” column, papers may mention multiple trait names. search_x_smart() functions many different operators columns can work upon. full details, run ?search_vt_smart ?search_vd_smart console. general always worthwhile inspecting data retrieve VectorByte make sure query returned data thought .
code: df <- search_vt("Bemisia")[1:6] %>%   fetch_vt() %>%   extract_vt(cols = c("DatasetID", "Interactor1Genus", "Interactor1Species", "Interactor2Genus", "Interactor2Species")) unique(df$Interactor1Genus) ## [1] "Bemisia"      "Axinoscymnus" df %>% dplyr::filter(Interactor1Genus == "Axinoscymnus") %>% head() ## Database: vt ##   DatasetID Interactor1Genus Interactor1Species Interactor2Genus ## 1       158     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 2       158     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 3       158     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 4       158     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 5       158     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 6       158     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ##   Interactor2Species ## 1             tabaci ## 2             tabaci ## 3             tabaci ## 4             tabaci ## 5             tabaci ## 6             tabaci df <- search_vt_smart("Interactor1Genus", "contains", "Bemisia")[1:6] %>%   fetch_vt() %>%   extract_vt(cols = c("DatasetID", "Interactor1Genus", "Interactor1Species", "Interactor2Genus", "Interactor2Species")) unique(df$Interactor1Genus) ## [1] "Bemisia"

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: Often presented set population dynamic data, may wish investigate abiotic conditions temperature humidity dynamics occurred . Ideally sort data collected time dynamics data. However data collected one project repurposed another, often possible. scenarios possible link location data measurements abiotic variables area. can retrieved raster files provided projects ERA5 data store Copernicus project, however often large amount data small number datapoints.

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: alternative method gathering data AREAdata project, provides historical forecast data aggregated different spatial scales. Let’s take look format data retrieved AREAdata (deconstruct command properly bit): quite lot data! Way much print , given ’s 374016 entries, however want print data rather just summary, can add argument full = TRUE print command: AREAdata outputs formatted matrices. rows correspond locations (identified GADM codes): Meanwhile column names correspond day data refers : value ad_df["Angola", "2020-01-01"] corresponds value metric (case temperature) Angola 2020-01-01:
code: library(ohvbd)  ad_df <- fetch_ad(metric = "temp", gid = 0, use_cache = TRUE) print(ad_df) #> Areadata matrix for temp at gid level 0 . #> Cached: FALSE  #> Dates: 2020-01-01 -> 2023-12-31 (1461) #> Locations: 256 print(ad_df, full = TRUE) head(rownames(ad_df)) #> [1] "Aruba"       "Afghanistan" "Angola"      "Anguilla"    "Åland"       #> [6] "Albania" head(colnames(ad_df)) #> [1] "2020-01-01" "2020-01-02" "2020-01-03" "2020-01-04" "2020-01-05" #> [6] "2020-01-06" ad_df["Angola", "2020-01-01"] #> [1] 29.33611

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: call fetch_ad() used slightly odd parameters, let’s break bit. arguments provided metric = “temp” gid = 0 use_cache = TRUE cache_location = cachepath

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: metric argument tells fetch_ad() type data retrieve AREAdata. many valid options including temperature humidity. (See AREAdata run ?fetch_ad() R console full list).

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: gid argument tells fetch_ad() spatial scale download (higher numbers corresponding finer scales, cost larger download sizes).

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: AREAdata files large monolithic, often advantageous download data given spatial scale . can caching files retrieving needed. Whilst manually, ohvbd already functionality perform behind scenes. set use_cache = TRUE instead downloading repository immediately, ohvbd first try load cached version may present. Typically, cache location folder user directory, obtained tools::R_user_dir(). However, want overwrite (want share cache different scripts) can provide alternative path save data .

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: given , let’s construct another function call download relative humidity data province level (gid 1), caching folder. (execute , just gid level 1 data significantly larger gid level 0)

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: Extracting data matrix can fiddly, luckily ohvbd also provides function aid : extract_ad(). let’s try extract data previously, temperature Angola 2020-01-01: Note: ignore attr part output, data just allows ohvbd ensure consistency functions. Wonderful! want range dates, many places? dates fall outside dates data , places actually present data? extract_ad() really shines.

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: Let’s first look flexibility date arguments extract_ad(). (example) want just one day, can specify either vector dates, less exact date targetdate instead like specify date range, can add argument enddate. Note: end date defined exclusively, meaning date (target date) considered “”.

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: Multiple places extract data can also provided vector places: can combined date filters create restrictive extraction:
code: ad_df %>% extract_ad(   targetdate = "2020-01-01",   places = c("Angola", "Latvia", "United Kingdom") ) #>         Angola         Latvia United_Kingdom  #>      29.336107       1.765062       5.113141  #> attr(,"db") #> [1] "ad" ad_df %>% extract_ad(   targetdate = "2020-01-01",   enddate = "2020-01-04",   places = c("Angola", "Latvia", "United Kingdom") ) #> Areadata matrix for temp at gid level 0 . #> Cached: FALSE  #> Dates: 2020-01-01 -> 2020-01-03 (3) #> Locations: 3

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: extract_ad() function also relatively resilient use dates places AREAdata:
code: ad_df %>% extract_ad(   targetdate = "2023-12-30",   enddate = "2024-01-02",   places = c("Atlantis", "Latvia", "United Kingdom") ) #> Areadata matrix for temp at gid level 0 . #> Cached: FALSE  #> Dates: 2023-12-30 -> 2023-12-31 (2) #> Locations: 2

title: Associate other data sources with AREAdata data — assoc_ad
text: data source data bind AREAdata . must contain decimal lonlat data! areadata AREAdata bind, usually fetch_ad(). targetdate ONE following: date search ISO 8601 (e.g. "2020", "2021-09", "2022-09-21"). start date range dates. character vector fully specified dates search (.e. "yyyy-mm-dd") enddate (exclusive) end range dates search . unfilled, targetdate searched . gid spatial scale retrieve (0 = country-level, 1=province-level...). lonlat_names vector containing column names longitude latitude columns ORDER! basereq url AREAdata database (usually generated ad_basereq()). NA, uses default.

text: date range partially open interval. say lower bound (targetdate) inclusive, upper bound (enddate) exclusive. example date range "2020-08-04" - "2020-08-12" return 7 days 4th 11th August, 12th.

title: Associate other data sources with AREAdata data — assoc_ad
text: cases full date provided, earliest date possible available data chosen. "2020-04" internally become "2020-04-01" incomplete date specified targetdate enddate specified, range search inferred minimum temporal scale provided targetdate. example "2020-04" taken mean month April 2020, enddate internally set "2020-05-01".

AREAdata dataset gid=1, provide country names, function attempt match country names retrieve GID1-level data present. Occasionally (case "Albania", municipality La Guajira, Columbia) name place may occur locations expected researcher. Unfortunately easy problem mitigate, worthwhile checking output function make sure expect.

title: ohvbd 0.5.2
text: fetch_ad() now searches retrieves --date GID2 files AREAdata. New timeout parameter fetch_ad() control timeouts AD downloads. Defaults 4 minutes. assoc_ad() now correctly extracts data (functionality regressed 0.5.0 consequence new method dispatch approach data retrieval) assoc_ad() also gives now consistent output even 1-dimensional output returned extract_ad() fetch_ functions now default connections argument 2, leading faster retrieval across board. check_src argument removed functions. longer serves much purpose due sanity checking changes implemented 0.5.0.

title: ohvbd 0.5.1
text: fetch_vd() now correctly returns data datasets 50 rows. fetch_vd() also now tells much data retrieving coarse estimate long take. New function fetch_vd_counts() allows quick checking dataset sizes. important datasets VecDyn 40,000 rows long! fetch_ functions (thus also fetch()) now use parallel data retrieval, even 1 connection used. seems lead 20% gain download speed cost.

title: ohvbd 0.5.0
text: find_ functions retrieve metadata column definitions ids. fetch_ functions retrieve actual datasets. side effect longer falsely triggering data continuity checks fetch_ functions indexing output find_x_ids() functions. can now write code find_vt_ids() %>% fetch() %>% extract() without remember correct extractor use. can still use specific extractor functions desire. major functions interfacing AD, VD, VT output one classes. Cached data AD now contains attribute signify cached. New classes subclassed base R classes, mostly behave way (.e. can subset ohvbd.data.frame way just subsetting normal df). New function ohvbd.ids() allows users create objects S3 class output find_ search_ functions. New is_cached() function enables simple check see object loaded cache ohvbd.

what: Full list of function name changes:
title: ohvbd 0.5.0
text: get_ad() -> fetch_ad() get_extract_vd_chunked() -> fetch_extract_vd_chunked() get_extract_vt_chunked() -> fetch_extract_vt_chunked() get_gadm_sfs() -> fetch_gadm_sfs() get_vd() -> fetch_vd() get_vt() -> fetch_vt() get_vd_columns() -> find_vd_columns() get_vd_current_ids() -> find_vd_ids() get_vt_current_ids() -> find_vt_ids()

title: ohvbd 0.4.4
text: New function check_ohvbd_config() allows easy printing current status ohvbd’s options. New clean_ad_cache() function enables users clean cached AREAdata files easily. Build timings now appear vignettes. Cli outputs now suppressed running vignettes non-interactive mode (e.g. knitting). Default cache path now user directory (obtained tools::R_user_dir()). use-areadata vignette now part content complete. Generally update setting stage another major API overhaul 0.5.0.

title: ohvbd 0.4.3
text: Large changes vb get_ search_ function error handling functions now check automatically SSL issues, recommend set_ohvbd_compat() detected. get_ calls requesting 10 ids run pre-flight ssl check attempting whole thing. get_vd() get_vt() now also return list ids missing curl errors found process trying get data.

title: ohvbd 0.4.2
text: set_ohvbd_compat() now asks user confirmation interactive mode. makes running linux little annoying, worth due seriousness disabling SSL identity verification. asked R session running batch mode, knittr, testthat. retrieving-data vignette now enables compatibility mode running linux. Generally best keep package usage set_ohvbd_compat() absolute minimum. Copyright holder now listed DESCRIPTION

title: ohvbd 0.4.1
text: New parallel downloading options get_x() get_extract_x() functions. used caution, put significantly load server sequential run . New argument check_src allows toggling id-sanity checking functions. retrieving-data vignette now contains instructions use search_x_smart().

title: ohvbd 0.4.0
text: Major simplification function names! get_x_byid() -> get_x() extract_x_data() -> extract_x() assoc_x_y() -> assoc_x() get_extract_x_byid_chunked() -> get_extract_x_chunked() breaks PREVIOUS CODE! Naming now follows logical scheme verb_target_modifier(). example get_x_y() functions always retrieve data database x y specifying special type data. Similarly extract_x() functions always extract data. function multiple things, may get multiple verbs separated underscores, e.g. get_extract_x_chunked() Pipelines now internally attempt confirm data integrity checking correct functions piped together. means longer easy accidentally something like get_vd_current_ids() %>% get_vt().

title: ohvbd 0.3.1
text: New function format_time_overlap_bar() allows visually formatting range dates combined another set target dates see overlaps take place. mostly used error handling extract_ad() however can also used independently. designed fill general role within UI design using cli package, usable (hackable) others needing tool. extract_ad() now errors targetdate entries outside range AREAdata dataset. New assoc_ad() associates arbitrary data including lon/lat columns AREAdata. New get_vd_columns() provides quick reference currently present VecDyn columns. (currently possible VecTraits, feasibility investigated.) New assoc_gadm() function associates gadm ids spatial scales arbitrary data include lon/lat columns. Documentation now correctly displays favicons. Logo now rotates variety colourschemes according version number.

title: ohvbd 0.3.0
text: *_basereq() calls longer required first argument functions. , data downloads longer need start vb_basereq() %>%. Basereq can now overridden providing alternative basereq basereq argument functions, can generated using vb_basereq(). usually needed using argument unsafe = TRUE vb_basereq(). also possible set ohvbd use compatability-mode ssl calls using set_ohvbd_compat(). change breaks code written prior version, major rewrites may required.

title: ohvbd 0.2.5
text: extract_ad() now allows targetdate specified vector full dates, e.g. c("2023-08-04", "2023-09-21").

title: ohvbd 0.2.4
text: VecTraits & VecDyn search functions longer return stale responses search fails.

title: ohvbd 0.2.3
text: VecTraits functions now use cli package provide nicer cli interface. VecDyn functions now use cli package provide nicer cli interface.

title: ohvbd 0.2.2
text: AREAdata functions now use cli package provide nicer cli interface. retrieving-data vignette now builds significantly quicker.

title: ohvbd 0.2.1
text: get_ad() now caches data AREAdata reduce extraneous data downloading speed re-execution development. requires new argument use_cache=TRUE caches default user directory.

title: ohvbd 0.2.0
text: Install instructions now include correct command building vignettes installing GitHub. New check_db_status() allows easy checking online status various data providers. ohvbd now interfaces AREAdata repository historical climate data. includes functions get filter AREAdata datasets different spatial scales.

title: ohvbd 0.1.4

title: ohvbd 0.1.3

title: ohvbd 0.1.2
text: New search_vd() search_vd_smart() now allow searching VecDyn manner VecTraits.

title: ohvbd 0.1.1
text: get_vb_basereq() renamed vb_basereq() ease writing.

title: ohvbd 0.1.0
text: Chunked retrieval now correctly uses chunksize argument. ohvbd now interfaces VecDyn database vector population dynamic data. includes functions get ids, get datasets, extract data responses. functions use api structure VecTraits data download, vd replacing vt function names (e.g. get_vd())

title: ohvbd 0.0.5

title: ohvbd 0.0.4

title: ohvbd 0.0.3
